inference:
The area of the square is $6^2 = 36$ cm$^2$.
The radius of each circle is $2\sqrt{3}$ cm.
The area of each circle is $\pi (2\sqrt{3})^2 = 12\pi$ cm$^2$.
The area of the four quarter circles is $4 \times \frac{1}{4} \times 12\pi = 12\pi$ cm$^2$.
The area of the shaded region is the area of the square minus the area of the four quarter circles.
Area of shaded region = $36 - 12\pi$ cm$^2$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{36-12\pi}$ cm$^2$. I hope it is correct.

inference:
The area of the square is $6^2 = 36$ cm$^2$.
The radius of each circle is $2\sqrt{3}$ cm.
The diameter of each circle is $4\sqrt{3}$ cm.
The side length of the square is 6 cm.
The circles are quarter circles.
The diameter of each circle is equal to the side length of the square, which is 6 cm.
Thus, the radius of each quarter circle is 3 cm.
Area of each quarter circle is $\frac{1}{4} \pi (3^2) = \frac{9\pi}{4} \text{ cm}^2$.
Area of the four quarter circles is $4 \times \frac{9\pi}{4} = 9\pi \text{ cm}^2$.
The area of the shaded region is the area of the square minus the area of the four quarter circles.
Area of shaded region = $36 - 9\pi$ cm$^2$.

$\boxed{36-9\pi}$
